intro: Fagraea gracilis, commonly known as the slender fagraea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Fagraea gracilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
